subject: Philosophy
title: Critiques of Stoicism
description: A short lesson to help you apply Critiques of Stoicism.

hook.text: Critics say Stoicism teaches people to accept injustice instead of fighting it.

buildup.text: If you focus only on internal reactions, doesn't that excuse oppression and systemic problems?

discovery.text: The Stoics actually demanded social engagement. Marcus governed an empire. Cato fought a tyrant.

twist.text: But the emphasis on inner calm can be weaponized: 'Just change your attitude' ignores real suffering.

climax.text: Modern Stoics argue: change what you can externally, accept what you truly can't. Both matter.

punchline.text: Acceptance isn't surrender. It's choosing your battles.

quiz.question: What is a common critique of Stoicism?
options: It may encourage accepting injustice passively
